title: NIPS_2002_18_abs

sentences.text: A bio-inspired model for an analog programmable array processor -LRB- APAP -RRB- , based on studies on the vertebrate retina , has permitted the realization of complex programmable spatio-temporal dynamics in VLSI .
This model mimics the way in which images are processed in the visual pathway , rendering a feasible alternative for the implementation of early vision applications in standard technologies .
A prototype chip has been designed and fabricated in a 0.5 µm standard CMOS process .
Computing power per area and power consumption is amongst the highest reported for a single chip .
Design challenges , trade-offs and some experimental results are presented in this paper .

summary: A bio-inspired model for an analog programmable array processor -LRB- APAP -RRB- , based on studies on the vertebrate retina , has permitted the realization of complex programmable spatio-temporal dynamics in VLSI . This model mimics the way in which images are processed in the visual pathway , rendering a feasible alternative for the implementation of early vision applications in standard technologies . A prototype chip has been designed and fabricated in a 0.5 µm standard CMOS process . Computing power per area and power consumption is amongst the highest reported for a single chip . Design challenges , trade-offs and some experimental results are presented in this paper .

Predicate-mimics.label: mimics
Predicate-mimics.description: The predicate 'mimics' indicates that the subject (an entity or process) imitates or reproduces the behavior, characteristics, or functioning of the object (another entity, process, or system). In general, it suggests a similarity or approximation between the two entities.

Predicate-is_implemented_by.label: is implemented by
Predicate-is_implemented_by.description: The predicate 'is implemented by' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has its functionality or purpose realized through another entity (the object). In other words, it describes how something is achieved or carried out using specific means, methods, or tools.

Predicate-are_presented.label: are presented
Predicate-are_presented.description: The predicate 'are presented' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, Design challenges) provides or offers information to someone or something about the object (this paper). The presentation can be physical, such as giving a talk or displaying an exhibit, or abstract, like presenting ideas or concepts. In general, it implies that the subject is providing access to knowledge, insights, or perspectives related to the object.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates a relationship where the subject relies on or has its foundation, principles, or methodology derived from the object. It suggests that the subject's existence, functionality, or validity are grounded in or dependent upon the characteristics, concepts, or ideas represented by the object.

Predicate-has_permitted.label: has permitted
Predicate-has_permitted.description: The predicate 'has permitted' indicates that the subject has given permission or authorization for something to happen, be done, or exist. It implies a sense of approval, consent, or allowance, connecting the subject with an action or state that was previously restricted or prohibited.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is related to another more general or overarching concept, which is represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject has a higher-level category or classification within a hierarchical structure.
